body: Found a reduced test case thanks to creduce!
It appears to go away if `#[unsafe_destructor]` is added.

Another reduced test case, without any destructors at all:

``` rust
struct A;

impl<'a> A {
    fn test(v: Vec<&'a int>) {}
}

fn main() {
}
```

Compiler output with backtrace:

```

composite.rs:1 struct A;
               ^~~~~~~~~

                   ^~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~~

```

It seems that the compiler dislikes `impl<'a>` with `Vec<&'a something>` because when I put `<'a>` on the function the error goes away. The following compiles fine:

``` rust
struct A;

impl A {
    fn test<'a>(v: Vec<&'a int>) {}
}

fn main() {
}
```

It is a regression, because the code which causes this error used to compile a few weeks ago.
Closing as a dupe of #14889 (same code in reduced case).
